author: SeeminglyScience
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6?view=powershell-6).

-->

# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
Add-Type -TypeDefinition '

public class A
{
    public static object B
    {
        get
        {
            System.Console.WriteLine("Getter invoked.");
            return null;
        }
    }

    public object C
    {
        get
        {
            System.Console.WriteLine("Getter invoked.");
            return null;
        }
    }
}'

$a = [A]::new()

# $a.C.<tab>
TabExpansion2 -inputScript '$a.C.' -cursorColumn 4
```

# Expected behavior

The getter method is not called and type is inferred by referencing the stored adapter data.

```none
CurrentMatchIndex ReplacementIndex ReplacementLength CompletionMatches
----------------- ---------------- ----------------- -----------------
               -1                3                 1 {System.Management.Automation.CompletionResult, System.Manageme...
```

# Actual behavior

The getter method is invoked during tab completion.

```none
Getter invoked.

CurrentMatchIndex ReplacementIndex ReplacementLength CompletionMatches
----------------- ---------------- ----------------- -----------------
               -1                3                 1 {System.Management.Automation.CompletionResult, System.Manageme...
```

# Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.2.0-preview.4
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.2.0-preview.4
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17134
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

# Remarks

While most property get accessors are pretty safe to call, there are plenty with side effects that may be surprising if triggered during tab completion/intellisense.

This happens with both static and instance properties. Though in the case of instance properties, only when an existing instance is being referenced.

```powershell
# Getter invoked
$a.C.<tab>

# Getter not invoked
[A]::new().C.<tab>

# Getter invoked (also throws NRE, haven't looked into why the instance code path doesn't)
[A]::B.<tab>
```
title: Type inference invokes property getter methods
